vehicles.description: Several vehicles are visible in the distance, driving ahead on the highway in the same direction as the ego car
vehicles.explanation: These vehicles could slow down, change lanes or stop, which would require the ego car to adjust speed or change lanes accordingly.

traffic cones.description: Orange and white traffic cones are placed in a line, separating the highway lanes and indicating a lane reduction or a road construction area on the right-hand side of the road.
traffic cones.explanation: The cones necessitate that the ego car maintains its position in the left lane and does not attempt to merge right.

barriers.description: A solid metal barrier is visible on the right side, running along the highway
barriers.explanation: This barrier restricts the ego vehicle to the highway and indicates that merging right beyond the cones is not possible.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, several vehicles are visible in the distance, driving ahead on the highway in the same direction as the ego car. These vehicles could slow down, change lanes, or stop, which would require the ego car to adjust its speed or change lanes accordingly. 

There are orange and white traffic cones placed in a line, separating the highway lanes and indicating a lane reduction or a road construction area on the right-hand side of the road. The cones necessitate that the ego car maintains its position in the left lane and does not attempt to merge right.

A solid metal barrier is visible on the right side, running along the highway. This barrier restricts the ego vehicle to the highway and indicates that merging right beyond the cones is not possible.

1.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, typically used to guide or restrict movement on roadways during road work or when a lane is closed for safety purposes. In this driving scenario, its presence indicates that the driver should remain cautious and possibly prepare to merge to adjacent lanes if the current lane becomes obstructed further ahead by road works or obstacles.

2.description and explanation: This object is a traffic cone, typically used for traffic management. Traffic cones are usually bright orange with a reflective stripe for visibility, and they are used to mark areas on roads or footpaths to caution or redirect traffic. Their presence on the road indicates that the driver of the car from which this image was taken should be vigilant and may need to adjust the vehicle's path to avoid the area designated by the cone, ensuring safety or compliance with temporary traffic changes.

driving_suggestion: Maintain a steady speed in the left lane, observe the vehicles ahead for any changes in speed or lane, and keep a safe following distance. Prepare to adjust speed or change lanes if the traffic ahead requires it, and do not attempt to merge into the right lane due to the traffic cones and metal barrier.
